item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "To the person in the bell jar, blank and stopped as a dead baby, the world itself is a bad dream." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "For you, a thousand times over" -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Ntozake Shange
item.description: "one thing I don’t need is any more apologies i got sorry greetin me at my front door you can keep yrs i don’t know what to do wit em they don’t open doors or bring the sun back they don’t make me happy or get a mornin paper didn’t nobody stop usin my tears to wash cars cuz a sorry." -- Ntozake Shange

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Oleander time, she said. Lovers who kill each other now will blame it on the wind. " -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Listen--are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Many people need desperately to receive this message: 'I feel and think much as you do, care about many of the things you care about, although most people do not care about them. You are not alone." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Remember it all, every insult, every tear. Tattoo it on the inside of your mind. In life, knowledge of poisons is essential. I've told you, nobody becomes an artist unless they have to." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "It's such a liability to love another person." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Charlotte Eriksson
item.description:
"6 months, 2 weeks, 4 days, and I still don’t know which month it was then or what day it is now. Blurred out lines from hangovers to coffee Another vagabond lost to love.
4am alone and on my way. These are my finest moments. I scrub my skin to rid me from you and I still don’t know why I cried. It was just something in the way you took my heart and rearranged my insides and I couldn’t recognise the emptiness you left me with when you were done. Maybe you thought my insides would fit better this way, look better this way, to you and us and all the rest. But then you must have changed your mind or made a wrong because why did you leave?
6 months, 2 weeks, 4 days, and I still don’t know which month it was then or what day it is now. I replace cafés with crowded bars and empty roads with broken bottles and this town is healing me slowly but still not slow or fast enough because there’s no right way to do this. There is no right way to do this.
There is no right way to do this." -- Charlotte Eriksson

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Like most misery, it started with apparent happiness." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kelsey add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis
